text: Hi guys. I need some help on making my HubSpot landing page more responsive. Would appreciate any help at all!
Where would the best place be to get some help!? Thanks!
I don’t think that’s an option as behind each website is a different HubSpot portal. We are not using the HubSpot cookie manager but OneTrust’s CookiePro, and they support cross domain consent.
you would want to look into CSS and media queries. Unless you have a very specific question, this is about all I can assist with

Hi. We drive Google Ads traffic through a landing page to a HubSpot Meeting window where the visitors book a meeting. We want to save the Google Ads id (gclid) in the contact that is created in HubSpot. But, there are no hidden fields or any other way we could use to transmit that gclid. Has anyone figured this out already, or knows a way how we can do it?
Is it possible to host a react webapp on here? I.e I make something in react, and I can host it through HubSpot? Tried the boilerplate, its a little buggy.
it'll be one page so no routing or rather very little if any
It makes literally no sense hosting an SPA like react if you have just one page / static content. By far too bloated.
would vue work better? Definitely using state changes
